description:
A grotesque, red face with horns, wide eyes, a large nose, crooked fangs, and a fringe of shaggy hair. Depicts an oni, a kind of hideous ogre in Japanese folklore.

On New Year’s Eve in some parts of Japan, men may wear oni masks and straw coats to dress up as namahage, another mythic being, to chide naughty children or ward off evil. May popularly denote supernatural or figurative beasts and demons.
apple_vendor_description: Apple's ogre emoji presents a fearsome yet somewhat stylized creature, characterized by its green skin, prominent horns, and a stern, unyielding expression. The design on Apple devices employs rich, deep colors and subtle, realistic lighting to give the ogre a tangible, almost mythological presence. Its sharp, angular features are softened by Apple's characteristic rounded edges, making it less overtly terrifying and more of a symbolic representation of something monstrous, difficult, or perhaps even a humorous exaggeration of a challenge in digital communication across Apple devices.
